alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:47PM EDT until July 20 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND CENTRAL LICKING COUNTIES... At 1047 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hanover to near Pataskala, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Hebron, Hanover, Beechwood Trails, Granville South, Summit Station, Marne, Whitehall, Etna, Kirkersville, Alexandria, St. Louisville and Port Columbus Airport. This includes I-70 in Ohio near mile marker 103, and between mile markers 114 and 124. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
